intro: Camissoniopsis robusta, commonly known as the robust camisson, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Camissoniopsis robusta is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
